contentrichtext.text: {{One source|date=February 2012}} {{No footnotes|date=February 2012}} '''Hormizd VI''' or '''V''' ({{lang-fa| هرمز}}), twenty-eighth [[Sassanid]] [[sassanid dynasty|King of Persia]], was one of the many [[pretender]]s who rose after the murder of [[Khosrau II]] (590–628) in 628. He maintained himself about two years (631–632) in the district of [[Nisibis]]. There was also a brief usurper king, not always numbered among the monarchs, called [[Hormizd V]] in 593. ==References== *{{1911}} {{S-start}} {{S-hou|[[Sassanid Empire|Sassanid dynasty]]||||}} {{S-bef|before=[[Azarmidokht]]}} {{S-ttl|title=[[List of kings of Persia|Great King (Shah) of Persia]]|years=631–632}} {{S-aft|after=[[Yazdegerd III]]}} {{end}} {{Sassanid Rulers}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Hormizd 06 | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 632 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hormizd 06}} [[Category:632 deaths]] [[Category:Sassanid dynasty]] [[Category:7th-century Persian people]] [[Category:7th-century monarchs in the Middle East]] [[Category:Year of birth unknown]] {{iran-royal-stub}}
